page.title: 15PARK PLACE & Druids' Temple.
page.content: PARK PLACE was built as a farm in 1719. General Conway bought the House in 1752 & lived there till his death in 1795.A fire destroyed it & the present House was built in 1870.Other owners have been Frederick,Prince of Wales(Father of George 111) & the Earl of Malmesbury In 1950,the House was used as a Boarding School for London boys.It is owned by Hillingdon & 43 "Delicate" boys live there now. In Jersey,a Mound was unearthed in 1787 & the DRUIDS' TEMPLE,dating from 3500 B.C.,was discovered.The granite stones were presented to General Conway,as he was Governor of Jersey & he had them brought to Park Place.Today, the Temple stands in a private garden belonging to Temple Combe.People from abroad visit this Historic Monument. From here,there is a magnificent view towards central Berkshire.
